Name: Saint-Marc Daiquiri
Ingredients: 50 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
7.5 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lime slice or wedge on rim.
Garnish with lime slice or wedge on rim.
Review: It's a Daiquiri with monastic Bénédictine and decadent absinthe influences. Perhaps it's the saffron in the Bénédictine or the anise in the absinthe-but the result is truly a spiritual experience. It's simply divine.
History: Adapted from a drink discovered in 2014 at Bastille Cafe & Bar in Seattle, Washington, USA.
Nutrition: One serving of Saint-Marc Daiquiri contains 185 calories
